explains: n. 竞技场；[建] 圆形露天剧场；古罗马剧场

sentences.en: Construction of the Roman Colosseum, which was officially known as the Flavian Amphitheater, began in A.D. 69.
sentences.cn: 罗马斗兽场的建造开始于公元69年，它的官方名称是弗拉维安圆形剧场。

sentences.en: They’re destroying a park to turn it over to a concrete amphitheater.
sentences.cn: 他们把公园毁了，在那上面盖了个大剧场。

sentences.en: It was mid-June, 1972, the Chicago Amphitheater was packed, sweltering, rocking.
sentences.cn: 1972年6月的一天，芝加哥圆形剧场挤满了大汗淋漓、疯狂摇摆的人们。
